thread.title: CBS pulls Katherine Heigl's 'Doubt' from schedule after only two episodes
thread.title_full: CBS pulls Katherine Heigl's 'Doubt' from schedule after only two episodes - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: CBS pulls Katherine Heigl's 'Doubt' from schedule after only two episodes
text:
Photo: JOJO WHILDEN, CBS Image 1 of / 99 99 DOUBT ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: After only two episodes, CBS pulled Katherine Heigl's new legal drama from their schedule thanks to abysmal ratings. While it has not yet been "officially" cancelled, this series will not be returning in the fall. (CBS)
less DOUBT ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: After only two episodes, CBS pulled Katherine Heigl's new legal drama from their schedule thanks to abysmal ratings. While it has not yet been "officially" cancelled, this series
... more Photo: JOJO WHILDEN, CBS Image 2 of 99 TRAINING DAY LIKELY CANCELLED: The recently departed Bill Paxton starred in CBS's reboot of the Denzel Washington film. If the series hadn't already been suffering from disappointing ratings before Paxton's death, they might have recast his role. However, after this weekend's events, there is now more reason than ever to not renew the low-rated cop drama. (CBS) less TRAINING DAY
LIKELY CANCELLED: The recently departed Bill Paxton starred in CBS's reboot of the Denzel Washington film. If the series hadn't already been suffering from disappointing ratings before Paxton's
... more Photo: Michael Yarish, CBS Image 3 of 99 SCREAM QUEENS LIKELY CANCELLED: Fox and series creator Ryan Murphy have a long history with each other, but it's doubtful that even a good relationship will save 'Scream Queens' from being cancelled after this season. After a fun first season, the second season has been a disaster, both storywise and in the ratings. News that star Lea Michele has joined the cast of a new pilot for ABC does not bode well for the horror anthology's chances of survival. (FOX) less SCREAM QUEENS
LIKELY CANCELLED: Fox and series creator Ryan Murphy have a long history with each other, but it's doubtful that even a good relationship will save 'Scream Queens' from being cancelled after
... more Photo: FOX Image 4 of 99 QUANTICO LIKELY CANCELLED: After dropping precipitously from its first season's ratings on Sunday nights, Quantico was moved to Monday nights to to ride The Bachelor's coattails. Unfortunately, the move did not work, and the series did not see an uptick in viewers. It is currently ABC's lowest rated drama and it is unlikely the network will try to save it again. (ABC) less QUANTICO
LIKELY CANCELLED: After dropping precipitously from its first season's ratings on Sunday nights, Quantico was moved to Monday nights to to ride The Bachelor's coattails. Unfortunately, the move did
... more Photo: Bob D'Amico, ABC Image 5 of 99 SLEEPY HOLLOW LIKELY CANCELLED: In an attempt to create buzz and reboot the series, Sleepy Hollow killed off one of its leads at the end of last season. While this desperate move bought the series one more season, the ratings have not improved -- in fact, it is Fox's lowest rated series, and it is unlikely Fox will give it another chance. (FOX) less SLEEPY HOLLOW
LIKELY CANCELLED: In an attempt to create buzz and reboot the series, Sleepy Hollow killed off one of its leads at the end of last season. While this desperate move bought the series one more
... more Photo: FOX Image 6 of 99 THE ODD COUPLE LIKELY CANCELLED: CBS announced that they would not be ordering a full season of the remake of the classic comedy. While that is not necessarily a death sentence, it doesn't bode well for the relatively low-performing sitcom either. It was a surprise when CBS renewed it last season, it will be shocking if they do so this season. (CBS) less THE ODD COUPLE
LIKELY CANCELLED: CBS announced that they would not be ordering a full season of the remake of the classic comedy. While that is not necessarily a death sentence, it doesn't bode well for the
... more Photo: CBS Image 7 of 99 ROSEWOOD LIKELY CANCELLED: The medical examiner show has dropped from a series high of 7 million viewers to regularly only pulling in around 3 million viewers. Additionally, this show doesn't have much in the way of buzz or critical acclaim. Fox didn't show much confidence in the series when it moved it to Friday nights mid-season. (FOX) less ROSEWOOD
LIKELY CANCELLED: The medical examiner show has dropped from a series high of 7 million viewers to regularly only pulling in around 3 million viewers. Additionally, this show doesn't have much in
... more Photo: FOX Image 8 of 99 CODE BLACK LIKELY CANCELLED: This medical drama has never performed particularly well for CBS, and it was a little surprising when CBS renewed it for a second season. The show's only hope is that CBS wants a medical drama, and having all but cancelled Pure Genius, this hospital series is all they have to fill that particular gap in their schedule. (CBS) less CODE BLACK
LIKELY CANCELLED: This medical drama has never performed particularly well for CBS, and it was a little surprising when CBS renewed it for a second season. The show's only hope is that CBS wants a
... more Photo: CBS Image 9 of 99 THE REAL O'NEALS LIKELY CANCELLED: I want this show about a broken family to work, I just don't know that it is the best fit for ABC's family block. It matches their diversity plan, but audiences aren't responding to it as well as they are to other family comedies. That said, it is produced by ABC/Disney, so they may give it more time to develop, as it's not losing audiences too quickly. (ABC) less THE REAL O'NEALS
LIKELY CANCELLED: I want this show about a broken family to work, I just don't know that it is the best fit for ABC's family block. It matches their diversity plan, but audiences aren't
... more Photo: Bob D'Amico, ABC Image 10 of 99 ELEMENTARY LIKELY CANCELLED: The modern version of Sherlock has had five seasons and has produced more than one hundred episodes making it sellable for syndication. Its ratings have declined each season, and it has outlived its usefulness for CBS' schedule. Expect this to be one of the shows CBS cuts to make room for a new series next season. (CBS) less ELEMENTARY
LIKELY CANCELLED: The modern version of Sherlock has had five seasons and has produced more than one hundred episodes making it sellable for syndication. Its ratings have declined each season, and
... more Photo: Patrick Harbron, CBS Image 11 of 99 THE EXORCIST LIKELY CANCELLED: The truth of the matter is that this sequel to the classic 1973 horror film was a fun little thrill ride, filled with legitimate scares. Unfortunately, it was stuck on Friday nights, and the audience just didn't showing up. That said, critics like it and it is produced by 20th Century Fox, so it might still have a slight chance in Hell. (FOX) less THE EXORCIST
LIKELY CANCELLED: The truth of the matter is that this sequel to the classic 1973 horror film was a fun little thrill ride, filled with legitimate scares. Unfortunately, it was stuck on Friday
... more Photo: FOX Image 12 of 99 RANSOM LIKELY CANCELLED: CBS took a gamble by introducing new scripted programming on Saturday nights with this procedural drama. Unfortunately for them, the gamble didn't pay off, and Ransom turned out to be CBS' lowest-rated series. (CBS) less RANSOM
LIKELY CANCELLED: CBS took a gamble by introducing new scripted programming on Saturday nights with this procedural drama. Unfortunately for them, the gamble didn't pay off, and Ransom turned out to be
... more Photo: CBS Image 13 of 99 SECRETS AND LIES ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: ABC did not have promising things to say about this mystery anthology series at a recent television conference. The second season ratings dropped from already disappointing first season numbers, and it actually performed worse than shows that have practically been cancelled by the network. (ABC) less SECRETS AND LIES
ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: ABC did not have promising things to say about this mystery anthology series at a recent television conference. The second season ratings dropped from already
... more Photo: Bob D'Amico/Craig Sjodin, ABC Image 14 of 99 FREQUENCY ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: This time-travel series based on the Dennis Quaid film was relatively well-received by critics, but not audiences. Along with No Tomorrow, The CW did not order more episodes. Chances for a second season are not looking great. (THE CW) less FREQUENCY
ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: This time-travel series based on the Dennis Quaid film was relatively well-received by critics, but not audiences. Along with No Tomorrow, The CW did not order more episodes.
... more Photo: Bettina Strauss, Bettina Strauss/The CW Image 15 of 99 NO TOMORROW ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: This romantic dramedy about a woman who falls in love with a man who believes the world is going to end soon just never gained any traction with audiences or critics. The CW did not order more episodes, the first time in 10 years it did not do so for a new fall series. Chances are there is no tomorrow for this series. (THE CW) less NO TOMORROW
ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: This romantic dramedy about a woman who falls in love with a man who believes the world is going to end soon just never gained any traction with audiences or critics. The
... more Photo: THE CW Image 16 of 99 NOTORIOUS ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: After being given a prime spot on ABC's schedule, nestled between Grey's Anatomy and How to Get Away With Murder, the legal/media drama was a ratings disappointment, and ABC declined to order more episodes. While it is not officially cancelled, it might as well be. (ABC) less NOTORIOUS
ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: After being given a prime spot on ABC's schedule, nestled between Grey's Anatomy and How to Get Away With Murder, the legal/media drama was a ratings disappointment, and ABC
... more Photo: Bob D'Amico, ABC Image 17 of 99 CONVICTION ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: Hayley Atwell starred in this legal drama about a bad-girl-turned-defender-of-the-innocent, but it failed to draw in viewers. ABC declined to order more episodes. While it is not officially cancelled, it might as well be. The biggest pity is that the creative and fun Marvel's Agent Carter was cancelled for this series. (ABC) less CONVICTION
ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: Hayley Atwell starred in this legal drama about a bad-girl-turned-defender-of-the-innocent, but it failed to draw in viewers. ABC declined to order more episodes. While it
... more Photo: Bob D'Amico, ABC Image 18 of 99 PURE GENIUS ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: This medical drama starring Dermot Mulroney didn't deliver anything new and viewers didn't show up. CBS declined to order new episodes outside of the 13 commissioned. While it is not officially cancelled, it might as well be. (CBS) less PURE GENIUS
ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: This medical drama starring Dermot Mulroney didn't deliver anything new and viewers didn't show up. CBS declined to order new episodes outside of the 13 commissioned. While

RENEWED: This is Us is the breakout hit of the season, and has been renewed for a second season on NBC. (NBC)

Photo: THE CW Image 33 of 99 D.C.'S LEGENDS OF TOMORROW RENEWED: Legends' might be The CW's lowest-performing of its superhero series, but that didn't stop them for renewing it for a third season. (THE CW) D.C.'S LEGENDS OF TOMORROW
RENEWED: Legends' might be The CW's lowest-performing of its superhero series, but that didn't stop them for renewing it for a third season. (THE CW)

Photo: THE CW Image 35 of 99 BOB'S BURGERS RENEWED: Fox has already renewed 'Bob's Burgers' for an 8th season, which will debut in 2017. (FOX) BOB'S BURGERS
RENEWED: Fox has already renewed 'Bob's Burgers' for an 8th season, which will debut in 2017. (FOX)
Photo: © 2011 FOX BROADCASTING Image 36 of 99 CRAZY EX-GIRLFRIEND RENEWED: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend is the best show you are not watching. Fortunately, The CW recognizes that fact and renewed it for a third season. The creators have said that they intend for it to run for four seasons, so next season might not be their last despite being the lowest rated show on network TV. (THE CW) less CRAZY EX-GIRLFRIEND

LIKELY RENEWED: Negotiations are in the works for two more seasons of network TV's biggest show. Considering the money involved, this is all but a done deal. (CBS)
Photo: CBS Image 44 of 99 FAMILY GUY LIKELY RENEWED: Though its ratings have dipped in recent seasons, Family Guy is still a solid performer for Fox. Between syndication and streaming, it is still making plenty of money for the network. Look for it to be renewed for the 2017-2018 season. (FOX) less FAMILY GUY
LIKELY RENEWED: Though its ratings have dipped in recent seasons, Family Guy is still a solid performer for Fox. Between syndication and streaming, it is still making plenty of money for the

(ABC) less THE BACHELOR/BACHELORETTE
LIKELY RENEWED: The Bachelor/Bachelorette/Bachelor in Paradise franchises have not officially been renewed for their next seasons beyond 2017, but considering they are all the biggest

It's just that simple. (CBS) less MADAM SECRETARY
LIKELY RENEWED: If you are a series on CBS produced by CBS Studios and you are in your third season -- which 'Madam Secretary' is -- you will get a fourth season, because that's where the
... more Photo: CBS Entertainment Image 47 of 99 LAW & ORDER: SVU LIKELY RENEWED: Now in its eighteenth season, this crime procedural has become a classic. It's unlikely that NBC will pull the plug on it -- especially when its creator, Dick Wolf, has given NBC its most recent hits with the 'Chicago' series. This series will end one day, but only when Dick Wolf says so. (NBC) less LAW & ORDER: SVU
LIKELY RENEWED: Now in its eighteenth season, this crime procedural has become a classic. It's unlikely that NBC will pull the plug on it -- especially when its creator, Dick Wolf, has given

It is likely to be renewed for a second season. (ABC) less SPEECHLESS
LIKELY RENEWED: This cheeky sitcom about a family that has a child with cerebral palsy has fit nicely with ABC's diverse family comedy lineup and performed well, ratings-wise. It is likely to be

Photo: NBC, Mark Seliger/NBC Image 52 of 99 SCORPION LIKELY RENEWED: Frankly, Scorpion 's' ratings aren't great compared to other CBS series. However, it is produced by CBS Studios, this is its third season, and it is about to hit that sweet syndication spot if it receives a fourth season. It will be kept alive for that reason alone. (CBS) less SCORPION
LIKELY RENEWED: Frankly, Scorpion 's' ratings aren't great compared to other CBS series. However, it is produced by CBS Studios, this is its third season, and it is about to hit that sweet
... more Photo: CBS Image 53 of 99 SUPERIOR DONUTS LIKELY RENEWED: CBS' new midseason comedy has outperformed older CBS comedy stalwarts Mom and 2 Broke Girls . And as the network's only multi-cultural comedy, CBS has an incentive to keep it around for image purposes. (CBS) less SUPERIOR DONUTS
LIKELY RENEWED: CBS' new midseason comedy has outperformed older CBS comedy stalwarts Mom and 2 Broke Girls . And as the network's only multi-cultural comedy, CBS has an incentive to keep it
... more Photo: CBS Image 54 of 99 GOTHAM LIKELY RENEWED: While it doesn't do as well as Empire, the Batman prequel does better than most other shows on Fox. That said, it's not a guaranteed renewal: it is not produced by 20th Century Fox, so even though another season would give it enough episodes for syndication sales, Fox won't benefit from that. If Fox comes up with a series they believe might perform better, there is a small chance they might drop Gotham. (But that is very unlikely.) (FOX) less GOTHAM
LIKELY RENEWED: While it doesn't do as well as Empire, the Batman prequel does better than most other shows on Fox. That said, it's not a guaranteed renewal: it is not produced by 20th Century Fox, so
... more Photo: FOX Image 55 of 99 THE WALL LIKELY RENEWED: NBC originally only ordered 10 episodes of the Chris Hardwick-hosted game show, but upped the order to 20 episodes when it performed well. Expect to see this series return for a second season, probably as a winter premiere. (NBC) less THE WALL
LIKELY RENEWED: NBC originally only ordered 10 episodes of the Chris Hardwick-hosted game show, but upped the order to 20 episodes when it performed well. Expect to see this series return for a second
... more Photo: NBC, Chris Haston/NBC Image 56 of 99 MACGYVER LIKELY RENEWED: The reboot of the Richard Dean Anderson series is holding its own on a difficult Friday night time slot. In fact, its numbers have been improving over time, despite not being popular with critics. (CBS) less MACGYVER
LIKELY RENEWED: The reboot of the Richard Dean Anderson series is holding its own on a difficult Friday night time slot. In fact, its numbers have been improving over time, despite not being popular
... more Photo: CBS Image 57 of 99 NCIS: LOS ANGELES LIKELY RENEWED: It's not pulling in 17 million viewers anymore, but the crime procedural is still drawing some 11 million, which in this television age is pretty strong. Chances are good it will receive a ninth season. (CBS) less NCIS: LOS ANGELES
LIKELY RENEWED: It's not pulling in 17 million viewers anymore, but the crime procedural is still drawing some 11 million, which in this television age is pretty strong. Chances are good it

Image 58 of 99 24: LEGACY LIKELY RENEWED: The 24 reboot has managed to hold on to a good portion of its debut audience and it is outperforming other Fox dramas. It is likely to be picked up for a second season. (FOX) 24: LEGACY
LIKELY RENEWED: The 24 reboot has managed to hold on to a good portion of its debut audience and it is outperforming other Fox dramas. It is likely to be picked up for a second season. (FOX)
Photo: FOX Image 59 of 99 LIFE IN PIECES LIKELY RENEWED: The multigenerational comedy is not CBS' best performer -- in fact, among the comedies, it is among its lowest. However, it is consistent, and since CBS doesn't have much else on the bench in the way of comedies, they will probably stick with a show it can depend on rather than taking a risk on something new. (CBS) less LIFE IN PIECES
LIKELY RENEWED: The multigenerational comedy is not CBS' best performer -- in fact, among the comedies, it is among its lowest. However, it is consistent, and since CBS doesn't have much else
... more Photo: Cliff Lipson, CBS Image 60 of 99 BLACK-ISH LIKELY RENEWED: Black-ish is not ABC's best performer, but it generates a lot of buzz, it is produced by ABC Studios, and since it is in its third season and about to become syndicatable, this is a given for renewal. (ABC) less BLACK-ISH
LIKELY RENEWED: Black-ish is not ABC's best performer, but it generates a lot of buzz, it is produced by ABC Studios, and since it is in its third season and about to become syndicatable, this is a
... more Photo: Bob D'Amico, ABC Image 61 of 99 LAST MAN STANDING LIKELY RENEWED: For the past six seasons, Last Man Standing has maintained a viewership somewhere between 6 and 7 million viewers, which is a steady performance, and it is the best performing show on Friday nights on any network. Chances are favorable for a renewal. (ABC) less LAST MAN STANDING
LIKELY RENEWED: For the past six seasons, Last Man Standing has maintained a viewership somewhere between 6 and 7 million viewers, which is a steady performance, and it is the best

(CBS) less CRIMINAL MINDS
LIKELY RENEWED: Even after the controversial departure of its star, Thomas Gibson, the crime procedural is still pulling in more than 7 million viewers and does well with DVR playback, so
... more Photo: CBS Image 63 of 99 BLUE BLOODS LIKELY RENEWED: The Tom Selleck cop drama is in its seventh season and still pulling in over 10 million viewers on a Friday night. That's really remarkable. Add to this the fact that it is produced by CBS Studios, and the network doesn't seem to have much incentive to get rid of the series. (CBS) less BLUE BLOODS
LIKELY RENEWED: The Tom Selleck cop drama is in its seventh season and still pulling in over 10 million viewers on a Friday night. That's really remarkable. Add to this the fact that it is
... more Photo: CBS Image 64 of 99 MODERN FAMILY LIKELY RENEWED: Modern Family is ABC's best performing series: eight seasons in, it's still bringing in 7 million viewers. It won't last forever, but it will last at least another season. (ABC) MODERN FAMILY
LIKELY RENEWED: Modern Family is ABC's best performing series: eight seasons in, it's still bringing in 7 million viewers. It won't last forever, but it will last at least another season. (ABC)
Photo: Bob D'Amico, ABC Image 65 of 99 THE GOLDBERGS LIKELY RENEWED: Four seasons in, The Goldbergs is second only to Modern Family in terms of ABC comedies. It will certainly be renewed for a fifth season. (ABC) THE GOLDBERGS
LIKELY RENEWED: Four seasons in, The Goldbergs is second only to Modern Family in terms of ABC comedies. It will certainly be renewed for a fifth season. (ABC)
Photo: Bob D'Amico, ABC Image 66 of 99 2 BROKE GIRLS LIKELY RENEWED: Chances are this comedy will be renewed for a seventh season. It's a solid performer and there are other comedies that are weaker. That said, 2 Broke Girls is getting a little long in the tooth, and CBS might only order half a season next year in an effort to make room for new shows. (CBS) less 2 BROKE GIRLS
LIKELY RENEWED: Chances are this comedy will be renewed for a seventh season. It's a solid performer and there are other comedies that are weaker. That said, 2 Broke Girls is getting a little
... more Photo: CBS Image 67 of 99 MOM LIKELY RENEWED: Mom is CBS' third-weakest comedy. But similar to 2 Broke Girls, the chances for renewal are favorable. Mom is an award-winner and critical favorite, so CBS will probably keep it around for the prestige value. (CBS) less MOM
LIKELY RENEWED: Mom is CBS' third-weakest comedy. But similar to 2 Broke Girls, the chances for renewal are favorable. Mom is an award-winner and critical favorite, so CBS will probably keep it around

Photo: Fox Image 98 of 99 DOUBT ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: After only two episodes, CBS pulled Katherine Heigl's new legal drama from their schedule thanks to abysmal ratings. While it has not yet been "officially" cancelled, this series will not be returning in the fall. (CBS)
less DOUBT ESSENTIALLY CANCELLED: After only two episodes, CBS pulled Katherine Heigl's new legal drama from their schedule thanks to abysmal ratings. While it has not yet been "officially" cancelled, this series
... more Photo: JOJO WHILDEN, CBS Image 99 of 99 CBS pulls Katherine Heigl's 'Doubt' from schedule after only two episodes 1 / 99 Back to Gallery "Doubt," CBS's new Katherine Heigl series, was already looking doubtful after only one episode. The legal drama had a weak debut, and after its second episode, CBS pulled it entirely from its schedule. Things are also not looking promising for another of CBS's underperforming new dramas, "Training Day," after the unexpected death of its star Bill Paxton.
Ultimately, there is only one real reason a show is considered for cancellation by a network: low ratings. This season there are at least 18 series that are in danger of being cancelled for underperforming. And of those series, 8, including "Doubt," are all but officially cancelled.
PERFECT TRIBUTE: Storm chasers honor Bill Paxton
In contrast, there are many reasons a network will renew a series: high ratings is an obvious one, but networks will sometimes bless a low-rated series with a renewal if there is enough critical praise or a deep degree of fan devotion. So far this year, 24 primetime network series have already been renewed for the 2017-2018 television season. Some shows, like "This is Us," were such break-out hits that renewal was all but inevitable; but others, like "Crazy Ex-Girlfriend," the lowest-rated show on network television, were given another season thanks to their creativity and the buzz they generate with critics and during awards season.
(Story continues below.)
Hollywood star Bill Paxton has died after suffering complications from surgery.
Media: Cover Media But the vast majority of series fall somewhere in between certain cancellation and renewal: they perform well enough that they are not obviously about to be cancelled, but they don't perform quite well enough to be given an automatic renewal before May when the networks reveal their fall television schedule.
In the gallery above, you will find the 18 series we think are in most danger of being cancelled, the 24 series that are safe for another season, and all of the shows that fall somewhere in between.
